5 (Carnegie, Minet, Waterloo Durning and Upper Norwood Joint ) out of 10 libraries considered for closure/move to volunteers due to 50% cuts to overall council budget.
Five libraries saved from closure : building shares, volunteers and booksales to limit impact of £700k cut over two years.
£200k upgrade to computers (replacing 180 XP machines with 150 new ones).
May be managed by Life Leisure Trust (Blaenau Gwent) or the Merthyr Tydfil Leisure Trust
Chislehurst Library site on sale from council: developer would need to build replacement.
Cardiff – All 7 threatened libraries will stay open after public campaign.  Alternatives being looked into.
Closure plans shelved after consultation. £500k to refurbish Clydesbank Library, £20k for public WC in Balloch Library.
Kingsclere Library to be run by 25 volunteers with parish council and charitable support.

8 out of 17 previously planned as being unstaffed will have some element of paid staffing: Bovingdon, Chorleywood, Goffs Oak, Kings Langley, London Colney, Sawbridgeworth and Woodhall will retain an element of paid staff. Buntingdon to have paid staff (volunteer assisted).

Closure of five libraries (Pheasey, Beechdale, Walsall Wood, Walsall South and Streetly) deferred for three months until July. Rushall, New Invention and Blakenall will close at some point later than July.
Barton under Needwood Library will become volunteer.
Powys – 20% cut in opening hours. Mobile libraries will move from fortnightly to four-weekly stops.
Burton under Needwood Library will become volunteer.

Ten volunteer libraries opened in recent years in Ball Green Methodist Church, Swan Bank Methodist Church, Burslem, Blurton Hub, Haywood Engineering Academy, Fenton Hub, St John’s Welcome Church in Abbey Hulton, Whitfield Valley Community Centre, Wallace Sport and Education Centre, Northwood Stadium and Trentham Mews Medical Centre.
(Clarification from council) – £2.5 million cut in library service per year expected to be reached by third year (£1m cut each Year 1 and Year 2, £500k cut Year 3).
£2.4m cut. Opening hours reduced. Consultation until April 17th.
7 (out of 27) libraries may close: Clifton, Eastville, Marksbury Road, Redland, Sea Mills, Westbury, Wick Road. £1.1m cut, 12 week consultation.

Reduced opening hours at Felling, Chopwell (may move to primary school), Rowlands Gill, Wreckenton (may move to community centre and be managed by housing company), Dunston (6 months "lifeline", looking at community transfer to volunteers), Pelaw (12 months until it needs to be volunteer run).
£305k cut p.a. (previously reported as £1.5m cut), increased opening hours due to self-service machines, staffed hours reduced from 261 to 149.
Cuts to library budget inc. possibility of opening hour cuts, volunteers, income generation.
No libraries (apart from mobile library) to close in £500k cut.  New library to open at Purlfleet.
